result.execSummary:
The defendant Uma K Rouse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 90 days or penalty of 6 days Huber for non payment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Uma K Rouse

Defendant Uma K Rouse in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following to count #2:
FINE: $631.00
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 90 days .  Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 6 days in Huber

Case recalled at 9:40 am.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  Court schedules sentencing.
